title: Using Google Adsense with Angular
body:
In a normal SSR, you only need to put an automatic ad script for Google Adsense in the `<head></head>` to serve ads and monetize them.

However, in the case of SPA, if only automatic ads are used, reloading does not occur due to page transitions, so the number of ads displayed is reduced in many cases to only fixed ads at the bottom of the page.

Therefore, [ng2- adsense](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ng2- adsense) can be used to manually set up ad spaces.

### ng2- adsense introduction

Environment: Angular v13

1. `npm install ng2- adsense`.

2. put the settings in `app.module.ts` (do this in the module associated with the component you want to display the ads, or in the module you created for common use).

```ts
@NgModule({
  declarations: [AppComponent],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    AppRoutingModule,
    AdsenseModule.forRoot({ adClient: 'ca-pub-**************' }),
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent],
})
export class AppModule {}
```

Add components of the layout you want to display where you want to display them.

```html
<ng2-adsense
  style="display: block"
  adFormat="fluid"
  slot="*******"
  layoutKey="********"
></ng2-adsense>
```

Please use the settings from Google AdSense for slot, layoutKey, etc.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29157528/158059598-f309054a-618f-46aa-aa80-b013a392894b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29157528/158059662-bfd1a4d8-778c-4e6c-8b63-83db0e7c8402.png)

The slots shown in ^ and others are supported.

You can display ads by making the above settings.

I would like to see automated ads available for SPAs as well, but I think it will be a bit difficult considering the type of ads that are inserted into page transitions.
